messages.title: Take a second look at the Tories
messages.content: The local Conservative council has let you down with cuts to services and a failure to fight for jobs.

messages.title: Vote David Boot
messages.content: A better deal for Stretford and Urmston; A better deal for all.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Tackling unemployment with support for job creation schemes. Fighting for jobs locally.
Protect the vulnerable while making necessary cuts. Labour will ensure recovery benefits all.
Support for a ticket to London before 9am at a reasonable price. Wants to make the fares system easier to understand.
Promise to protect funding for local schools and to fight for a new University Technical College.
Pledges to protect funding for local health services and to keep hospital health services in the constituency.

mentions.candidate: David is passionate about Stretford and Urmston

issues.economy: Labour: a better deal for Britain.
issues.education: Promise to protect funding for local schools
issues.health: Pledges to protect funding for local health services.

housing.content: More affordable homes for local people.

leaflet.personalStatement: I promise to fight hard for local people.

politicalExperience.achievements: In his work as a councillor, he has dealt with thousands of local queries and problems.

contactInformation.address: Labour Party Office, 25 Woodsend Road, Urmston M41 8JZ

quotes.text: The Labour manifesto was described by the independent Institute for Fiscal Studies as 'the most coherent attempt to reduce public spending for many years.'

images.caption: David Boot engaging with the community.
Proposed image of University Technical College.
David Boot with a background of housing and transportation.
